alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 6:30PM EDT until June 25 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE, THE CITY OF NORFOLK, THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms have produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Old Dominion University, Regent University, Virginia Wesleyan University, Churchland, Kempsville, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Cradock, Norview, Western Branch, Bowers Hill, South Norfolk and Portlock. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach
